title: An R Interface to OxCal
text: can install latest version ArchaeoCal repository : development version GitHub :

title: An R Interface to OxCal
text: example uses data available ArchaeoData package available separate repository. ArchaeoData provides OxCal input models.
code: ## Install the latest version install.packages("ArchaeoData", repos = "https://archaeostat.r-universe.dev") ## Load package library(ArchaeoCal)  ## Download and install OxCal oxcal_configure() ## Construct the path to the OxCal script path <- file.path("oxcal", "ksarakil", "ksarakil.oxcal") file <- system.file(path, package = "ArchaeoData")  ## Read the script from Bosch et al. 2015 scr <- readLines(file)  ## Print # cat(scr, sep = "\n")  ## Execute ## /!\ this may take a while /!\ out <- oxcal_execute(scr, file = "path/to/my/results")  ## Parse OxCal output res <- oxcal_parse(out) as.data.frame(res)

title: ArchaeoCal: An R Interface to 'OxCal' — ArchaeoCal-package
text: ArchaeoCal uses following options() configure behaviour: ArchaeoCal.verbose: logical scalar. R report extra information progress? Defaults interactive().

title: ArchaeoCal: An R Interface to 'OxCal' — ArchaeoCal-package

what: Coerce to a Data Frame — as.data.frame.OxCalResults
title: Coerce to a Data Frame — as.data.frame.OxCalResults
Coerce to a Data Frame — as.data.frame.OxCalResults
code: # S3 method for class 'OxCalResults' as.data.frame(x, row.names = NULL, optional = FALSE, ...)

title: Coerce to a Data Frame — as.data.frame.OxCalResults
text: x list returned oxcal_parse(). row.names character vector giving row names data frame description, NULL. optional logical scalar. FALSE names variables data frame checked ensure syntactically valid variable names duplicated. ... Currently used.

title: Coerce to a Data Frame — as.data.frame.OxCalResults
text: data.frame following columns: name  operation  type  date  error  agreement  convergence  like_range list giving confidence intervals likelihood. like_density list giving likelihood. post_range list giving confidence intervals posterior probability. post_density list giving posterior probability.

title: 14C Calibration with OxCal — oxcal_calibrate
text: names character vector specifying names dates (e.g. laboratory codes). dates numeric vector giving BP dates calibrated. errors numeric vector giving standard deviation dates calibrated. curve character string specifying calibration curve used.

title: 14C Calibration with OxCal — oxcal_calibrate
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## Download OxCal oxcal_configure()  ## Calibrate 14C dates cal <- oxcal_calibrate(   names = c("X","Y"),   dates = c(5000, 4500),   errors = c(45, 35) )  as.data.frame(cal) } # }

title: Configure OxCal — oxcal_configure
code: oxcal_configure(   path = oxcal_path(),   os = NULL,   install = TRUE,   ask = interactive(),   force = FALSE,   verbose = getOption("ArchaeoCal.verbose"),   ... )

title: Configure OxCal — oxcal_configure
text: path character string specifying path OxCal directory. os character string specifying operating system workstation. must one "Linux", "Windows" "Darwin". NULL (default), operating system determined automatically (see Sys.info()). install logical scalar: OxCal binary found, downloaded installed? ask logical scalar: OxCal installed, user asked downloading ? force logical scalar: OxCal already installed, reinstallation forced? verbose logical scalar: R report extra information progress? ... arguments passed oxcal_install().

title: Configure OxCal — oxcal_configure
text: oxcal_configure() called side-effect. Invisibly returns path OxCal executable.

title: Configure OxCal — oxcal_configure
text: Downloads latest version Oxcal (needed) sets executable path correctly.

title: Configure OxCal — oxcal_configure
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## Download OxCal oxcal_configure()  ## Custom script scr <- 'Plot()  {   Sequence("Sequence1")   {    Boundary("Begin");    Phase("Phase1")    {     R_Date("Lab-1",5000,25);     R_Date("Lab-2",4900,37);    };    Boundary("Between");    Phase("Phase2")    {     R_Date("Lab-3",4800,43);    };    Boundary("End");   };  };' out <- oxcal_execute(scr) res <- oxcal_parse(out)  as.data.frame(res) } # }

title: Execute an Oxcal Script — oxcal_execute
code: oxcal_execute(   script,   file,   path = oxcal_path(),   mcmc = NULL,   verbose = getOption("ArchaeoCal.verbose"),   ... )

title: Execute an Oxcal Script — oxcal_execute
text: script character string instructions OxCal. file character string naming file (without extension) write script . Output files named file written directory. path character string giving path OxCal executable. mcmc character string giving name output file MCMC samples (without extension). must match Name argument OxCal's MCMC_Sample() function. used script contains MCMC_Sample() command. verbose logical scalar: R report extra information progress? ... parameters passed system2().

title: Execute an Oxcal Script — oxcal_execute
text: list class OxCalOutput containing following elements: oxcal character string giving path .oxcal file. js character string giving path .js file. log character string giving path .log file. txt character string giving path .txt file. csv character string giving path .csv file.

title: Execute an Oxcal Script — oxcal_execute
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## Download OxCal oxcal_configure()  ## Custom script scr <- 'Plot()  {   Sequence("Sequence1")   {    Boundary("Begin");    Phase("Phase1")    {     R_Date("Lab-1",5000,25);     R_Date("Lab-2",4900,37);    };    Boundary("Between");    Phase("Phase2")    {     R_Date("Lab-3",4800,43);    };    Boundary("End");   };  };' out <- oxcal_execute(scr) res <- oxcal_parse(out)  as.data.frame(res) } # }

title: Download and Install OxCal — oxcal_install
text: target character string specifying directory extract OxCal files . created necessary (see utils::unzip()). source character string specifying url OxCal installed. verbose logical scalar: R report extra information progress? ... Currently used.

title: Download and Install OxCal — oxcal_install
text: oxcal_install() called side-effect. Invisibly returns path OxCal directory.

title: Download and Install OxCal — oxcal_install
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## Download OxCal oxcal_configure()  ## Custom script scr <- 'Plot()  {   Sequence("Sequence1")   {    Boundary("Begin");    Phase("Phase1")    {     R_Date("Lab-1",5000,25);     R_Date("Lab-2",4900,37);    };    Boundary("Between");    Phase("Phase2")    {     R_Date("Lab-3",4800,43);    };    Boundary("End");   };  };' out <- oxcal_execute(scr) res <- oxcal_parse(out)  as.data.frame(res) } # }

Read and Parse OxCal Output — oxcal_parse
code: oxcal_parse(path)  # S3 method for class 'OxCalOutput' oxcal_parse(path)

title: Read and Parse OxCal Output — oxcal_parse
text: path character string naming JavaScript file data read (list returned oxcal_execute()).

title: Read and Parse OxCal Output — oxcal_parse
text: list class OxCalResults containing following elements: ocd list OxCal data holds ranges, probability distributions, etc. parameter. model list information model. calib list information calibration curve.

title: Read and Parse OxCal Output — oxcal_parse

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## Download OxCal oxcal_configure()  ## Custom script scr <- 'Plot()  {   Sequence("Sequence1")   {    Boundary("Begin");    Phase("Phase1")    {     R_Date("Lab-1",5000,25);     R_Date("Lab-2",4900,37);    };    Boundary("Between");    Phase("Phase2")    {     R_Date("Lab-3",4800,43);    };    Boundary("End");   };  };' out <- oxcal_execute(scr) res <- oxcal_parse(out)  as.data.frame(res) } # }

title: Get OxCal Executable Path — oxcal_path
text: character string giving path OxCal executable.

title: Get OxCal Executable Path — oxcal_path
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## Download OxCal oxcal_configure()  ## Custom script scr <- 'Plot()  {   Sequence("Sequence1")   {    Boundary("Begin");    Phase("Phase1")    {     R_Date("Lab-1",5000,25);     R_Date("Lab-2",4900,37);    };    Boundary("Between");    Phase("Phase2")    {     R_Date("Lab-3",4800,43);    };    Boundary("End");   };  };' out <- oxcal_execute(scr) res <- oxcal_parse(out)  as.data.frame(res) } # }
